metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38476 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A data race could occur in the PK11_ChangePW function, potentially leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. In Firefox, this lock protected the data when a user changed their master password. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.2 and Thunderbird < 102.2.

criterions.comment: thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
